TITLE: Here’s the inflation breakdown for November 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Inflation was cooler than expected in November amid a slowdown in several broad consumer categories, according to the consumer price index issued Tuesday.

TITLE: 'It could be a blessing and a curse.' Here are 3 unexpected financial pitfalls unmarried couples need to know
SUMMARY: If you're living together before marriage or committed long-term, you'll need to prepare for the future. Here's what unmarried couples need to know.

TITLE: Used car prices are down 3.3% from a year ago — but still 'grossly inflated,' auto expert says. Here's where to find deals
SUMMARY: While used vehicle prices are coming down overall, there are some that show larger price drops than others, depending on the car type and age.

TITLE: This 529 savings plan myth is making college pricier for families, consultant says: 'It's candidly, blatantly not true'
SUMMARY: Paying for college is a financial burden, and experts say education funding myths may be adding to the student loan debt crisis. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Here's why salaries in the U.S. don't keep up with inflation
SUMMARY: While wages in the U.S. are rising, inflation has hit record highs, and most salaries are not keeping up. CNBC's Emily Lorsch explains why.

TITLE: Here’s what the Federal Reserve’s half-point rate hike means for you
SUMMARY: The Fed announced its last rate hike of the year to fight inflation. Here are your best money moves heading into 2023.

TITLE: You can still sign up for 2023 health insurance through the public marketplace — but waiting past Dec. 15 can delay coverage
SUMMARY: If you don't have health insurance lined up for next year, you can see if there's a good option through the federal marketplace or your state's exchange.

TITLE: Health insurance is helping cool inflation. But 'it's not a very good reflection' of what people pay, cautions economist
SUMMARY: Health insurance prices deflated the last two months, per the consumer price index, and are poised to fall more. That may not reflect what consumers pay.

TITLE: ‘There may be a false sense of security.’ How to know if your workplace disability insurance is enough
SUMMARY: Your company's group disability insurance plan may be less coverage than you think, experts say. Here's how to find out.

TITLE: Share of Americans living paycheck to paycheck rises to 63% — here's how to get your finances back on track
SUMMARY: The high cost of living is straining household budgets across the board. These moves can keep your budget in check heading into the new year.

TITLE: Long Covid medical costs average $9,500 in first six months, as patients become 'health-system wanderers'
SUMMARY: Long-haul symptoms of Covid-19 can be expensive for the average person to have diagnosed and treated, according to a new study by Nomi Health.

TITLE: 'There may be a false sense of security.' How to know if your workplace disability insurance is enough
SUMMARY: Your company's group disability insurance plan may be less coverage than you think, experts say. Here's how to find out.

TITLE: Student loan forgiveness is headed to the Supreme Court. What that means for the payment pause
SUMMARY: The Biden administration's most recent extension of the pandemic-era relief policy was more complicated than previous ones. Here's what borrowers need to know.

TITLE: Tax pros ‘expecting the worst' with Venmo, PayPal tax reporting change. How to handle a 1099-K for personal payments
SUMMARY: While the 1099-K tax reporting change applies to business payments, it's possible you'll receive one for personal transfers. Here's how to handle it.

TITLE: Up to 254,000 Medicare beneficiaries are getting new ID cards due to data breach at subcontractor. What they need to know
SUMMARY: Medicare officials said 254,000 beneficiaries may have had identifying information exposed in a ransomware attack that occurred in October.

TITLE: 88% of employers offer a Roth 401(k) — almost twice as many as a decade ago. Here’s who stands to benefit
SUMMARY: An increasing share of employers are making Roth 401(k) plan savings available to workers. But the accounts don't necessarily make sense for everyone.

TITLE: 'It never feels like you're out of poverty': comedian Moses Storm mines his trauma for laughs
SUMMARY: Growing up, comedy distracted Moses Storm from the fact that he often didn't have enough to eat. His stand-up special tackles poverty head on.

TITLE: ‘Porch pirates’ stole an estimated 260 million packages in the last year. How to prevent theft on your doorstep
SUMMARY: Package theft is expected to continue rising as more goods are purchased online and delivered to homes, experts say.

TITLE: The best bang for your buck: These 10-year-old used cars cost less than $16,000 and could go for another 100,000 miles
SUMMARY: A new report identified the used cars with the lowest prices and longest lifespans.

TITLE: Op-ed: Here are 5 questions to ask your financial advisor before the end of the year
SUMMARY: The end of the year is not just a great time to celebrate and give thanks but a chance to review your financial goals and plans with your financial advisor.

TITLE: Here are key things you need to know about health savings accounts as you near retirement
SUMMARY: Some of the rules governing HSAs, which let workers save pre-tax money for qualifying health expenses, are more pertinent — or different — for older adults.

TITLE: 21% of investors don't think they pay investing-related fees. Here's why they're wrong — and how it costs them
SUMMARY: Twenty-one percent of people incorrectly believe they don't pay fees to invest in non-retirement accounts, the FINRA Investor Education Foundation has found.

TITLE: Average Social Security retirement benefit fell short by 46% in 2022. Here are the costs the went up the most
SUMMARY: High inflation outpaced a record Social Security cost-of-living adjustment this year. Here's the prices that rose the fastest for households ages 65 and up.

TITLE: There's still time to reduce your 2022 tax bill with these last-minute moves
SUMMARY: There's still time to reduce your tax bill or boost your refund for 2022, according to financial experts. But the deadline is approaching.

TITLE: Long Covid patients can face a battle trying to claim benefits through their workplace disability insurance
SUMMARY: Given some of the subjective symptoms of long Covid, there's no guarantee that a claim filed for short- or long-term disability insurance will be approved.
